radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is hyperemic and enlarged up to 15 mm in maximal diameter with a hyperdense appendicolith at the base. Small amount of subjacent inflammatory changes involving the cecal tip and surrounding fat. No evidence of perforation or periappendiceal abscess. The lung bases are clear. The heart is normal in size. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands unremarkable. Bilateral kidneys enhance symmetrically without hydronephrosis. Stomach and bowel loops normal in caliber. Bladder, distal ureters, prostate, and rectum unremarkable. No inguinal or pelvic sidewall adenopathy or free fluid in the pelvis. No focal concerning lesion in bone window.
